m2OneMerge

public static weka.core.Instances m2OneMerge(weka.core.Instances dataA,
                                             weka.core.Instances dataB,
                                             int[] matchA,
                                             int[] matchB,
                                             int[] attributesB,
                                             java.lang.String missing)
m2oneMerge Completes merges Instances A with instances B where A.numInstances()> B.numInstances() for each instances where the value of the attribute matchA[n] = matchB[n]. Note: Since in the this program I will always be merging one two variables, title and date, the program assumes a two dimensional array for both matchA and matchB.

Parameters:
A - larger dataset
B - smaller dataset
matchA - two dimensional array of the indices of the variables in the dataset A to match on.
matchB - two dimensional array of the indices of the variables in the dataset B to match on.
attributesB - the attributes of b to keep
missing - string value to use in merge data if no values of B are availible

                                                   int[] attributes)
Removes the instances which have duplicate values for a given set of attributes

Parameters:
i - the data set
indices - of the attribute values which must be checked for duplicates
Returns:
a copy of i with duplicate instances removed
